alert.note: Alert for Southeast Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 2:41PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Montezuma and southeastern San Juan Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 240 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Aneth, or 31 miles northwest of Shiprock, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Montezuma and southeastern San Juan Counties. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 4 and 7. Utah 162 between mile markers 26 and 31. Colorado 41 between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
